meaningMnemonic: They <radical>say</radical> using a <radical>measurement</radical> device (like a ruler) is a good way to <kanji>chastise</kanji> someone. They do something bad? Chastise them by slapping their wrists, their feet, their eyes, ears, anything! They say something out of turn? CHASTISE THEM!
readingMnemonic: You're being <kanji>chastise</kanji>d because you tried to say something in English in <reading>とう</reading>きょう. Everyone around you slowly turned around, eyes aflame and rulers in hand, ready to chastise you for uttering those forbidden words.
